physical_appearance:This map is rectangular in shape and its perimeter is demarcated by dotted lines. It depicts the colonized territories of the East Indies by the different European powers. The different colours used to divide the East Indies correspond to the type of European colonizer controlling the lands. The map has a brown frame. The longitudes of the map indicate how many degrees every point is from London. The map has a brown frame and the logo of the East India company is displayed on the upper right of the map.
subject_terms_1:colonial settlements former territories/colonies/dependent states
subject_terms_2:Topographic maps Zoning Maps Historical geography Maps Colonization East Indies East India Company Asia
subject_terms_3:East India Company
sgcool_label_text:This map by Herman Moll
 a Dutch geographer based on London
 is dedicated to the Directors of the East India Company. It depicts the East Indies. with detailed captions explaining the territories belonging to England
 Spain
 France
 Holland
 Denmark and Portugal. It also features inset plans of the city of Bantam
 Fort St. George
 Madras and Batavia
 as well as inset views of the cities of Goa and Surat.

metadata.object_work_type: zoning maps historical maps topographic maps
metadata.title_text: A Map of the East Indies A Map of the East Indies by Herman Moll
metadata.physical_appearance: This map is rectangular in shape and its perimeter is demarcated by dotted lines. It depicts the colonized territories of the East Indies by the different European powers. The different colours used to divide the East Indies correspond to the type of European colonizer controlling the lands. The map has a brown frame. The longitudes of the map indicate how many degrees every point is from London. The map has a brown frame and the logo of the East India company is displayed on the upper right of the map.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Topographic maps Zoning Maps Historical geography Maps Colonization East Indies East India Company Asia
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This map by Herman Moll, a Dutch geographer based on London, is dedicated to the Directors of the East India Company. It depicts the East Indies. with detailed captions explaining the territories belonging to England, Spain, France, Holland, Denmark and Portugal. It also features inset plans of the city of Bantam, Fort St. George, Madras and Batavia, as well as inset views of the cities of Goa and Surat.
